diff_hunk:
@@ -109,6 +109,12 @@
 
 - func: matmul(Tensor self, Tensor other) -> Tensor
 
+# we define both of these because 'where' does the broadcast and '_s_where' doesn't;
+# this allows us to implicitly calculate the broadcast derivative, while only dealing with the
+# _s_where derivative.
+- func: where(BoolTensor condition, Tensor self, Tensor other) -> Tensor
+- func: _s_where(BoolTensor condition, Tensor self, Tensor other) -> Tensor
body: I'm not sure if I understand the comment. The downside of doing it like this is that we'll have `_s_where` show up in JIT traces.
